title: 9News Melbourne | Tuesday November 4 | Full Episode
description: Alicia Loxley and Tom Steinfort present the Melbourne news from Flemington, bringing a mix of celebration and serious news. Jamie Melham created sporting history at Flemington, becoming the first female jockey to complete the Caulfield-Melbourne Cup double aboard Half Yours. Off the track, a brazen arson attack in Dandenong saw a security guard threatened with a gun, while police investigate suspicious fires at auto repair and shisha businesses in the North. The Reserve Bank held the official cash rate steady at 3.6%, conceding inflation remains stubbornly high. title: 9News Adelaide | Tuesday November 4 | Full Episode
description: Brenton Ragless and Kate Collins lead the Adelaide news, leading with Jamie Melham creating sporting history by becoming the first female South Australian jockey to win the Melbourne Cup and the first to claim the Caulfield-Melbourne Cup double. In Adelaide court news, the public heard harrowing details in one of the state's worst child neglect cases involving the tragic death of a six-year-old girl. Economically, the Reserve Bank of Australia held the official cash rate at 3.6%, sparking speculation on future inflation and rate decisions. title: 9News Brisbane | Tuesday November 4 | Full Episode
description: Melissa Downs and Joel Dry lead the Queensland news, covering a historic Melbourne Cup win, local crime, and industrial action. Jamie Melham rode Half Yours to a famous victory, becoming the second woman to win the Melbourne Cup and the first to complete the Caulfield-Melbourne Cup double. In Ipswich, a woman driving a stolen car was arrested after intentionally ramming two police vehicles at a service station. Queensland's health workers are heading towards industrial action over a pay dispute, while teachers reject a final government offer.
